Subject: Re: [junit] Proposed parameterized test syntax for JUnit 4
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=12653864; y=CSvciAcmmQ8jhaZ0S4hWC-lIGF2gtRVzpP7Cu21wqp_81RNs

Eugene Kuleshov wrote:
> Hi Kent,
> 
>    Are you suggesting that groupping test classes per fixture will be 
> the only supported option in JUnit4?
> 

This has always been how JUnit is designed and intended to be used. That 
said, many testers and test suites (including myself and my suites, and 
apparently even some of JUnit's own suites) tend to gravitate toward one 
test class per tested class. This is a very common pattern, even if it's 
one JUnit wasn't meant to support and one that causes test suites to 
take longer to run than they otherwise would.

This does make me wonder if maybe JUnit has been cutting the wrong way 
all these years. Perhaps it should be designed to organize tests by 
model class rather than fixture. This certainly seems a lot more natural 
to a lot of developers.

--
